contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|SAT|Sat|Sats|sat|sats}} The '''[[SAT]]''', or the Reasoning Test (formerly Scholastic Aptitude Test and Scholastic Assessment Test) is a college admissions test in the United States. '''Sat''', '''SAT''', etc., may also refer to: {{TOC right}} == Aviation == * [[Germania (airline)]] (formerly Special Air Transport), based in Berlin, Germany * [[SAT Airlines]], a Russian airline based in Sakhalin * [[San Antonio International Airport]] (IATA code) of the airport in San Antonio, Texas, USA * [[SATS Ltd]], the chief ground-handling and in-flight catering service provider at Singapore Changi Airport * [[Static air temperature]], the temperature of the air around an aircraft == Educational testing == * [[College Scholastic Ability Test]], or Suneung (수능), a standardized test for admission to South Korean universities * [[National Curriculum assessment]], a series of educational assessments in the United Kingdom colloquially known as Sats or SATs * SAT 10, [[Stanford Achievement Test Series]], tests assessing knowledge of school pupils in the United States == Entertainment == * [[Sat.1]], a German television channel * [[The S.A.T.]], a professional wrestling tag team == Government == * [[Sat (Romania)|''Sat'' (Romania)]], the smallest unit in Romania County administration * [[Special Assault Team]], the counter-terrorist unit of the National Police Agency of Japan * [[State Administration of Taxation]], China's internal revenue service * [[State Administrative Tribunal of Western Australia]], an independent body that makes and reviews a range of administrative decisions * [[Su Altı Taarruz]], Turkish special naval attack commandos == Language and linguistics == * [[Sat (letter)]], a letter in the Ge'ez alphabet * [[Sat (Sanskrit)]], an adjective in Sanskrit meaning "the ideal; pure and true essence (nature)" * [[Santali language]] (ISO 639-3 language code) == Mathematics == * [[Boolean satisfiability problem]], determining if there are variables of a Boolean formula that make it True (algorithms to do this are called ''SAT solvers'') == Meteorology == * [[Surface air temperature]] [http://data.giss.nasa.gov/gistemp/abs_temp.html] == Medicine == * [[blood oxygen saturation]] ("sats") == Technology == * Abbreviation of (artificial) [[satelite]], an object which has been placed into orbit by human endeavour * .SAT, (Standard ACIS Text), a file extension for [[ACIS]] CAD files == Other == * [[Sat (rapper)]] (born 1975), stage name of French rapper Karim Haddouche * Sat., abbreviation for [[Saturday]] * [[Sennacieca Asocio Tutmonda]] (World Non-national Association), a worldwide association of leftist Esperanto-speakers == See also == * [[SATS (disambiguation)]] * {{Intitle|SAT}} * {{Lookfrom|SAT}} {{disambiguation}}
